segments.text: with Mr. Evans on the 11th of April, 1999, the anniversary of the first shots at Fort Sumter that started the Civil War in 1861.
Happened to read the paper today.
The weather outside in Bracketville today is cloudy, but on the inside is bright and sunny.
We were chatting about the beginning of your agricultural work and your ranching.
When did you first go into the land business for yourself?
He called me up to tell him that the Brown Brothers loved him.
Now you say the Brown brothers.
Is this Herman and George Brown in Houston?
How long had you known them?
That land up in the panhandle, did it by chance have any oil underneath it?
Thirteen years, never fail to make a profit.
Now, your favorite cattle are red.
Now you've been both in ranching and farming.
Which crop did you enjoy growing most?
Now, when did you acquire the Nine Bar Ranch?
He said, I don't do that by his name.
He said, if you'll take that land.
I had it by the band.
I knew that I didn't like it back then.
He said, boy, I don't remember him.
He got him, you know, from me.
Oh, she said, man, the talented boy.
He said, man, I forgot to have that.
I don't know what to do, but that was a kid.
What were the joys of being in the farm and ranching business?
Go to the side one day.
Let's take a version of that one.
A girl came around to get the order.
I bet there were 50 white people in the area.
Sir, I was saying, I didn't want it.
If you were buying land today
If I were buying land and came to you for advice, where would you tell me to look at land most closely?
When did you buy this land?
Do you run cattle on it?
Let's go back to Texas A&M.
in the highway department was he a big man physically who was it that's
decided he was the one to bring to A&M.
Because he came as dean of engineering and then became president.
Was he easy to work with?
Who was the executive director of the former students then?
trying to remember who was leading the former students in those years.
And Dr. Harrington was coming up on the faculty.
Did you remain in connection with him after you finished as a student?
Did he and Ruth Harrington get married soon after his college days?
She's still living there in Bryan.
